actions.recommendation: Please start exercising very slowly. Start by increasing your walking from once a week and build up to at least 5 times per week. As you get fitter you can increase the pace and intensity of your exercise. If the high heart rate persist indefinitely then please consider a cardiology check up.
High fasting insulin suggests that you are prediabetic. We want to reverse this if possible through lifestyle changes - a low carb diet, weight loss, exercise and stress reduction.
Take 5000iu of vitamin D daily and recheck in 4 months aiming for a level of 50 to 80.
Eliminate all refined carbohydrates and eat as close to nature as possible. For example lentils and chickpeas rather than bread, pasta and pizza.
Take 'active' b vitamins such as the methycare formula to lower high homocysteine level. You are aiming for a level around 7.
